OP

how do you guys cope with the fact that OF egirls are making tens of millions a year? this shit is really unbelievable man i am seething so hard holy fuck

61889273
I literally just don't care. Nobody will ever love them and I can also make 10 million without displaying my butthole for the world to see

61889278
It's only like top1% creators making millions

61889279
>>61889273
i didnt care too for so long but now im starting to care fml its just so unfair.. Not only are they extremely hot they also get to make 20MM a year for years scamming with bikini pics on OF

its just so unfair i feel like crying

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61889986
>>61889270
Doesn't bother me in the least.
Firstly, it causes tons of women to throw their lives away being whores. So is hardly a victory for women.
Secondly, what does that money do other than ruin their lives? Women crave a man higher on the totem pole than they are, now they can't find one for two reasons.

61892313
>>61889270
I make faceless straight gay porn. I just ride a bunch of dildos pretending its my first time and they get to pretend they are the ones.

Gigs not bad pays about 5k a month. My wife is my manager and hells clean my dildos.

Its not pleasurable by any means just feels like a fat shit

61892450
>>61892313
lmao

61893140

everyone compares themselves to women, they are people too after all not some different species

Show the world your talent.

My a PBJ using your dick to spread the stuff.

Profit.

Don’t give up until you try.

61893392

61893415
>>61889279
nigga are you stupid, hot girls have always had ez mode, any girl with looks + little brains can hustle money like crazy. I knew a waitress 2 years ago working in a shitty diner that was finessing 3-4 boomers, I remember one time a boomer literally handed her a $3,000 check, no sexual favors or anything, just sweet talk, this chick was spending 5-10,000 dollars a month on clothes and was driving a brand new Jeep luxury model

>>61889270

61893483

61893517
>>61889270

61893555
I have never paid for porn or whores in my life.

61893557
>>61889270
the same way I cope with dude getting paid millions to play with balls, I don't care. it's not me and it doesn't impact me, so why should I give a shit?

61893569
99% of them are making like 20 bucks a month lmfao

61893631
>>61889354
I met a girl who was a friend of a friend of mine at a party when I was younger and she literally handed me a business card with her OF address on it. I didn't realize what it was at first but the second I read it I blurted out "What the fuck is wrong with you?" without thinking and she got super offended. I'm pretty sure I was the first person she handed it to that actually said anything negative about it by the way she reacted, which is very bizarre to me. It's kind of crazy how common this shit is.

61893680
>>61889270
Like everything in the world of money being born a woman was a gamble
You just lost it

item.title: Cashing out — 18 replies — 72.0/hr
item.content:encoded:
Cashing out

Open thread • Replies: 18 • Updated: 2026-02-24 21:48 UTC

OP

Alright boys, i need some creative ideas to cash out 250k+ USDT into my personal bank. I have both US and Canadian banks. Anyone have experience getting this kind of cash back into the traditional banking systems without raising alarms?

Early replies (first 3)

61897352
>>61897340
btc atm

61897367
>>61897352
fees are way too high and limits are like 1k. Also need it in my bank, dont have use for that much cash

61897436
>>61897340
what are the taxes on casino winnings in muttland?

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61897453
>>61897436
0 in canadastan, but afaik no in-person casinos accept crypto deposits

61897496
>>61897340
Cant you send it to an account in a crypto exchange and then send it to your bank account?

61897520
>>61897496
Transfers from crypto exchanges to banks are usually flagged and raise a lot of questions, not to mention tax implications

61897533
>shills switched from "hey guys" to "hey boys"
Its time to kill you all, with chemical warfare

61897647
>>61897533
what am i shilling u poor phaggot? Get ur money up so u can contribute to the convo or fk off

61897658
>>61897340
My bank made me prove plausibly where the money came from by providing W4 pay statements for 4 years.
I moved $300k USD to EUR from U.S. banks to an E.U. bank.

61897671
>>61897647
>hey guys
>hey boys
>hey hey hey brahhhhs
KYS you spamming piece of shit

61897678
>>61897340
Honeypot thread

61897682
>>61897678
u have nothing to worry about with ur 0.005 btc

61897691
>>61897671
reply reeks of curry, take ur broke indian ass out of my thread

61897698
>>61897658
thats what i was afraid of, been in crypto since 2017 so the trail of these txns is long gone

61897730
>>61897698
Try using only the biggest banks in the richest countries you have access to. USA. Germany. U.A.E. And use many banks to split the money.

61897754
>>61897730
yeah figured splitting it up is the only way. did you send wires directly from ur crypto exchanges or did u cash out a diff way?

61897763
>>61897691
Deflect as much as you like, you obviously can't divorce your idioms and idiolect

61897766
>>61897754
Keep each transfer under $8999 if possible but these days they're aggregating and tracking with Palantir AI so you need different banks in different jurisdictions.
Also use wise.com and store some money there also you can use foreign currencies and precious metals.

They literally legally can't use it in most contexts yet but with clarity their business can become much more efficient and as a result their core holding increases in value. There is LITERALLY no reason to argue they are not building for its use other than being butthurt that it is true and trying to repress reality like a faggot. They literally have Fednow service providers running XRPL nodes and big banks who are their largest outside investors issuing bonds that reward in XRP (who were celebrated recently in their specific crypto efforts by the financial regulator of Japan) and are partnering with DBS (biggest bank in Singapore (Switzerland of Asia) and Franklin Templeton (trillion plus dollars AUM) building out a repo market on the XRPL. They got ONDO issuing on the XRPL, one of the largest asset managers in Europe/England doing same while basically no one is getting headway in England, Societe General (one of biggest banks in Europe) expanding to include XRP for their euro stablecoin which can bridge to RLUSD using XRP, etc. Literally everything they do builds around corporately driving XRP's adoption, literally just fleshing out a business sweet around it.

item.title: European funds for an american — 42 replies — 18.4/hr
item.content:encoded:
European funds for an american

Open thread • Replies: 42 • Updated: 2026-02-24 19:38 UTC

OP

I want to put 20% of my account in foreign, but not all foreign is created equal.

I predicted the rise in the polish economy. It's very simple, a homogenous white country free from communism is always going to become rich. A diverse country full of communists like Canada and South Africa is going to get worse and worse.

I also predicted that the real-estate market in Croatia would sky rocket due to whites fleeing countries like the UK. I was right.

So.... are there any good mutual/index funds that target the white regions of Europe, that an American can invest in? Is there a Balkans fund? A Baltic fund? Norway/Finland fund (not Sweden or Denmark)? I do not want to invest in the UK, France, Germany, or Spain.

Early replies (first 3)

61890485
>finland
>white

61890499
>please buy my bag
nein. Death to every communist, that includes every single member of a political party, everyone over 50, every bureaucrat and every single subsidized "private" which in europe is every company.

61890518
No fucking way those numbers on finland are right. I live in Helsinki and it’s like 25% brown.

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61891164
>>61890868
This is in fact, old data.

>>61891134
Yes. That's why I said funds that invest in Norway and Finland, but not Denmark and Sweden. I know Finland isn't really Nordic but they're next door.

61891236
>>61891154
That's fine but from the average person's perspective you can't understand the bigger economic picture and appreciate the vast differences in market size and capital flows.
Life for average people may be more or less similar in Croatia and England but the English stock exchange is in another universe compared to these small economies.
As I said, I'm an American living in Latvia. My life is better in Latvia. I'm just a normal guy. The top 1% and .01% would see things quite differently. Where does one park $100,000,000 in the Baltics?
Answer: you don't. And downstream from that is YOU don't get to invest $50,000 in an Estonia market ETF either. These are frontier markets not even as developed as Brazil or India.

61891243
>>61891003
Euskadi

61891374
>>61891236
I think real-estate, and downstream from that medical services, are pretty simple by and large because they're mostly just a matter of predicting the migration patterns of middle class white people, while avoiding the political behavior of lumpenprole voters. At a bare minimum investing in medical services and realestate are a safe bet in any communist free white flight destination.

Question then becomes, what financial products are available to me that resemble that in any way.

There's a fund called NHCBHFFT that invests in real estate in estonia, for example.

61891396
>>61890472
>I do not want to invest in the UK
FTSE100 has been outperforming the S&P500 for a while now but okay

61891622
>>61891396
I want a stock that will perform well long term, the UK, like Canada and South Africa, has not future unless it claws it's way back from Weimar conditions. The massive white flight that has already taken place and has been accelerating, looks exactly how things looked for Detroit, Chicago, Oakland, Baltimore, etc...

Ghettofication is an economy killer. Because people ignore it and it makes people irrational, that is the area an investor can exploit.

61892062
>>61890472
Brown migration is stagnating across Europe and so is the birthrate of migrants of the 2nd/3rd generation. The number of migrants are not big enough to not be outbred in the long run.

61892245
>>61890472

Now Bulgarian gypsies are also abroad and the roles are reversed, lol (except for France, that's only getting worse).

61892365
>>61892062
sounds like copium

61892695
>>61892062
White flight is the real economy killer. Again, look at all the places already mentioned. Niggers in america don't have exceptional birthrates but once they're 20% of a city everyone else runs away. Same as true for states and countries. Most nigger cities in America have half the population they had the in 60s. Akron and Cleveland have lost about half of their population due to white flight.

61892982
>>61890855
This.
I’m polish and I can explain a bit just to give a gist.
Poland’s “capitalist” period started in ‘89 so to this day the biggest companies included in WIG20 are completely controlled by National Treasury. So 8 of them constitute about 55% of the index.
So mind you by loading up on indexes you’re not really buying innovation rather iron clad businesses that aren’t really growth oriented.
Let’ take an example of searching for growth sectors like everyone talks about polish developers so it would be safe to assume that IT stuff has growth potential.
And here the biggest IT company is CD project which makes fucking games a dying industry that will be killed by small teams with ai making indie games.
Rest of well known IT firms are privately owned or controlled by ventures.
It’s hard to really find good stuff I personally think you should search for companies making tangible products or services example solar panels, beauty sector, pharma.
We’ve got a lot of ecomerce, construction, pharma/cosmetics, news outlets. Not really innovative stuff.

I mean I wish it was different but really if someone made something meaningful here he would be molested to death by venture capital like CVC Capital Partners and eventually cave in take cash run and live a beautiful trad life in Bielsko Biała.

61893067
>>61892982
Cont.
So to comparing to the US, Poland is a polar opposite.
In the US Capital lobbies politics. In Poland the only people who can lobby are foreign players and people with political power. And this political power has more influence on the stock market while in the US stock market and capital makes politics.
The end communist era ripples through Poland up to this day. The people responsible for the transition made themselves very powerful and control the capital to this day. The good news it that their descendants are retarded beyond comprehension and will be unable to maintain power.

61895024

>>61890472
Look into EU military companies. Saab, Rheinmetall etc. have had huge growth and are still on the rise.
Also whatever alternative renewables there are. (Things like synthetic fuels and deep geothermal)
Also companies that are processing rare earths and minerals. It is expected that the Europeans will start to extract those resources soon. The usual structure is that companies from outside the EU can mine, but are contractually obligated to sell most of the resources to companies inside of the Union for processing.

Also tech is fine. Plenty of EU countries are turning their backs towards US tech. Many government offices are currently swapping to different software, mostly open source. Expect EU companies to code scaleable European solutions soon.
